question.title: Capitalize and Count
question.content:
Given a string s of single space-separated words. Capitalize the first letter of all words and count the number of the words in the string. Print the line and the number in separate lines with new line character at the end.

Examples: 

Input: s = "welcome to the world of geeks"
Output: 
Welcome To The World Of Geeks
6
Input: s = "are you enjoying programming"
Output:
Are You Enjoying Programming
4

rephrased.body: Given a string `s` consisting of space-separated words, capitalize the first letter of each word and count the total number of words in the string. Print the modified string and the word count on separate lines, each followed by a newline character.

testcases.input: welcome to the world of geeks
testcases.output:
Welcome To The World Of Geeks
6

hints:
use string function title , count

let given string be s

s.title()

s.count(param)

where param is, string to count

as the words are separated by ' ' ( space).

count the space

s.count(' ')

welcome to the world of geeks

The number of spaces is 5, but the word count is 6.

so word count will be 1 more than the count of space.
